TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Clayey-skeletal, smectitic, frigid Udic Haplustalfs

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:  Derecho cobbly loam, forested. (Colors are for dry soil unless otherwise noted.)
O1--1 inch to 0; forest litter in various stages of decomposition.
A11--0 to 3 inches; grayish brown (10YR 5/2) cobbly loam, very dark grayish brown (10YR 3/2) moist; weak very fine granular structure; soft, friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; many very fine and fine and few medium and coarse roots; many very fine pores; 20 percent gravel, 15 percent cobbles; neutral (pH 7.2); abrupt smooth boundary.  (2 to 5 inches thick)
A12--3 to 12 inches; grayish brown (10YR 6/2) gravelly loam, dark grayish brown (10YR 4/2) moist; weak very fine granular structure; soft, friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; many very fine and fine few medium and coarse roots; many very fine pores; 35 percent gravel; neutral (pH 7.2); abrupt smooth boundary. (5 to 10 inches thick)
B21t--12 to 21 inches; brown (10YR 5/3) very cobbly heavy clay loam, dark brown (10YR 4/4) moist; weak fine subangular blocky structure; slightly hard, friable, sticky and plastic; common very fine and fine, few coarse roots; many very fine tubular pores; many thin clay films on faces of peds; 40 percent gravel, 20 percent cobbles; mildly alkaline (pH 7.4); gradual smooth boundary. (10 to 20 inches thick)
B22t--21 to 36 inches; brown (10YR 5/3) extremely cobbly clay, dark brown (10YR 4/3) moist; moderate fine subangular blocky structure; hard, firm, sticky and plastic; few very fine, fine and medium roots; many very fine tubular pores; many thin clay films on faces of peds; 40 percent gravel, 20 percent cobbles, 10 percent stones; mildly alkaline (pH 7.4); gradual smooth boundary. (10 to 20 inches thick)
B23t--36 to 51 inches; yellowish brown (10YR 5/4) extremely stony clay, dark yellowish brown (10YR 4/4) moist; weak fine subangular blocky structure; very hard, very firm, sticky and plastic; few very fine roots; common very fine tubular pores; many thin clay films on faces of peds; 30 percent gravel, 30 percent cobbles, 20 percent stones; mildly alkaline (pH 7.6); clear wavy boundary. (10 to 20 inches thick)
C--51 to 60 inches; grayish brown (10YR 5/2) extremely stony sandy clay loam, dark grayish brown (10YR 4/2) moist; massive; hard, firm, sticky and plastic; 60 percent gravel, 20 percent cobbles, 15 percent stones; mildly alkaline (pH 7.6).

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION:  Taos County, New Mexico; NW1/4 NE1/4 section 31, T.24N., R.14E.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:  The mean annual soil temperature is 40 degrees to 44 degrees F. and the mean summer soil temperature is warmer than 47 degrees F. Thickness of the solum ranges from 45 to 60 inches.  Rock fragments range from 40 to 80 percent in a major part of the solum and the C horizon. The solum is neutral or mildly alkaline but in some pedons the C horizon is calcareous.
The A1 horizon has value of 4 through 6 dry, 2 or 3, moist and chroma of 2 through 4. It is loam, light sandy clay loam and has 20 to 35 percent gravel and 5 to 40 percent cobbles.
The B2t horizon has hue of 7.5YR or 10YR, value of 5 through 7 dry, 4 or 5 moist and chroma of 2 through 6. It is clay, sandy clay and heavy clay loam and has 10 to 40 percent gravel, 20 to 60 percent cobbles and 10 to 60 percent stones.
The C horizon has hue of 7.5YR or 10YR, value of 5 or 6 dry, 4 or 5 moist and chroma of 2 through 6. It is sandy clay loam or clay loam and has 40 to 60 percent gravel, 20 to 40 percent cobbles and 10 to 60 percent stones.

COMPETING SERIES.content: COMPETING SERIES:  These are the Bignell (T), Crest (T), Pinata, and Ring series. Bignell, Crest and Pinata soils have Ap horizons with moist value of 4 or more or dry value of 6 or more. Ring soils have sola less than 45 inches thick.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content: GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:  Derecho soils are on sides of mountains and canyons at elevations of 8,000 to 10,500 feet. Slopes typically range from 10 to 60 percent. Most of these soils are on southerly aspects.  The soils formed in material weathered from interbedded shale and sandstone of the Pennsylvanian Formation. Annual precipitation ranges from 18 to 35 inches with peak periods in winter and late summer. Mean annual temperature is 38 degrees to 40 degrees F. and the summer temperature is 50 degrees F.

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content: GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:  These are the Angostura, Etoe, Jaroso and Maes soils. Angostura and Jaroso soils have a cryic temperature regime. Etoe soils have argillic horizons extending below depth of 60 inches. Maes soils have a udic moisture regime.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY:  Well drained; medium runoff; moderately slow permeability.

USE AND VEGETATION.content: USE AND VEGETATION:  These soils are used for timber production, range, recreation, water production and wildlife habitat. Native vegetation is Gambel oak, mountain-mahogany, and various grasses with widely spaced Douglas-fir, white fir and ponderosa pine.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:  High mountains of north-central and northern New Mexico. The series is of moderate extent.
